document_title: Rural Economic Development Loans and Grants
program_description_redl_redg: fund eligible projects using local utility organizations as intermediary lenders
program_description_redl_funds_use: projects that help create and keep jobs in rural areas
program_description_redl_repayment_flow_: Ultimate recipients directly repay the lending utility
lending utility then repays USDA Rural Development
program_description_redg_mechanism: local utility organizations use USDA-awarded grants to establish revolving loan funds (RLFs)
program_description_redg_rlf_purpose: support projects that help create or keep rural jobs
program_description_redg_repayment_flow: Once the RLF is exhausted or otherwise ends, the grant is then repaid to USDA Rural Development
who_can_apply_1: Current USDA Rural Development Electric or Telecommunications programs borrowers
who_can_apply_2: Former USDA Rural Development borrowers that have paid off their loan or loans
who_can_apply_3: Nonprofit utilities eligible for assistance from USDA RD Electric or Telecommunications programs
who_can_apply_important_note: REDLG is open only to current and former USDA Rural Development Electric or Telecommunications borrowers and nonprofit utilities eligible under the Rural Electrification Act
eligible_area_description: rural areas or towns with populations of 50,000 or fewer
how_funds_can_be_used_1: Facilities and equipment necessary to educate and train residents in rural economic development
how_funds_can_be_used_2: Facilities and equipment to provide medical care to rural residents
how_funds_can_be_used_3: Start-up venture costs, including such things as financing fixed assets like real estate, new or existing buildings, equipment, or working capital
how_funds_can_be_used_ultimate_recipient: Community development assistance to nonprofits and public bodies (particularly for job creation or retention)
loan_grant_terms_description: vary for intermediaries and ultimate recipients
general_note_consult_official_instructio: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local Rural Development office for help.
general_note_usda_equal_opportunity_stat: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
